segment.source: Microsoft network client Digitally sign communications (if server agrees) (Windows 10)
segment.target: Microsoft network client Digitally sign communications (if server agrees) (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Microsoft network client Digitally sign communications (if server agrees) security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Microsoft network client Digitally sign communications (if server agrees) security policy setting.

segment.source: Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (if server agrees)
segment.target: Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (if server agrees)

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (if server agrees) security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (if server agrees) security policy setting.

segment.source: Reference
segment.target: Reference

segment.source: The Server Message Block (SMB) protocol provides the basis for Microsoft file and print sharing and many other networking operations, such as remote Windows administration.
segment.target: The Server Message Block (SMB) protocol provides the basis for Microsoft file and print sharing and many other networking operations, such as remote Windows administration.

segment.source: To prevent man-in-the-middle attacks that modify SMB packets in transit, the SMB protocol supports the digital signing of SMB packets.
segment.target: To prevent man-in-the-middle attacks that modify SMB packets in transit, the SMB protocol supports the digital signing of SMB packets.

segment.source: This policy setting determines whether SMB packet signing must be negotiated before further communication with the Server service is permitted.
segment.target: This policy setting determines whether SMB packet signing must be negotiated before further communication with the Server service is permitted.

segment.source: Implementation of digital signatures in high-security networks helps to prevent the impersonation of client computers and servers, which is known as "session hijacking."
segment.target: Implementation of digital signatures in high-security networks helps to prevent the impersonation of client computers and servers, which is known as "session hijacking."

segment.source: But misuse of these policy settings is a common error that can cause data loss or problems with data access or security.
segment.target: But misuse of these policy settings is a common error that can cause data loss or problems with data access or security.

segment.source: If server-side SMB signing is required, a client computer will not be able to establish a session with that server, unless it has client-side SMB signing enabled.
segment.target: If server-side SMB signing is required, a client computer will not be able to establish a session with that server, unless it has client-side SMB signing enabled.

segment.source: By default, client-side SMB signing is enabled on workstations, servers, and domain controllers.
segment.target: By default, client-side SMB signing is enabled on workstations, servers, and domain controllers.

segment.source: Similarly, if client-side SMB signing is required, that client device will not be able to establish a session with servers that do not have packet signing enabled.
segment.target: Similarly, if client-side SMB signing is required, that client device will not be able to establish a session with servers that do not have packet signing enabled.

segment.source: By default, server-side SMB signing is enabled only on domain controllers.
segment.target: By default, server-side SMB signing is enabled only on domain controllers.

segment.source: If server-side SMB signing is enabled, SMB packet signing will be negotiated with client computers that have SMB signing enabled.
segment.target: If server-side SMB signing is enabled, SMB packet signing will be negotiated with client computers that have SMB signing enabled.

segment.source: Using SMB packet signing can impose up to a 15 percent performance degradation on file service transactions.
segment.target: Using SMB packet signing can impose up to a 15 percent performance degradation on file service transactions.

segment.source: There are three other policy settings that relate to packet-signing requirements for Server Message Block (SMB) communications:
segment.target: There are three other policy settings that relate to packet-signing requirements for Server Message Block (SMB) communications:

segment.source: Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (always)
segment.target: Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (always)

segment.source: Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (always)
segment.target: Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (always)

segment.source: Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (if client agrees)
segment.target: Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (if client agrees)

segment.source: Possible values
segment.target: Possible values

segment.source: Enabled
segment.target: Enabled

segment.source: Disabled
segment.target: Disabled

segment.source: Not defined
segment.target: Not defined

segment.source: Best practices
segment.target: Best practices

segment.source: Configure the following security policy settings as follows:
segment.target: Configure the following security policy settings as follows:

segment.source: Disable Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (always).
segment.target: Disable Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (always).

segment.source: Disable Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (always).
segment.target: Disable Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (always).

segment.source: Enable Microsoft Network Client: Digitally Sign Communications (If Server Agrees).
segment.target: Enable Microsoft Network Client: Digitally Sign Communications (If Server Agrees).

segment.source: Enable Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (if client agrees).
segment.target: Enable Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (if client agrees).

segment.source: Alternately, you can set all of these policy settings to Enabled, but enabling them can cause slower performance on client devices and prevent them from communicating with legacy SMB applications and operating systems.
segment.target: Alternately, you can set all of these policy settings to Enabled, but enabling them can cause slower performance on client devices and prevent them from communicating with legacy SMB applications and operating systems.

segment.target: Location

segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options

segment.source: Policy management
segment.target: Policy management

segment.source: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: Restart requirement
segment.target: Restart requirement

segment.source: None.
segment.target: None.

segment.source: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.
segment.target: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.

segment.source: Security considerations
segment.target: Security considerations

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: Vulnerability
segment.target: Vulnerability

segment.source: Session hijacking uses tools that allow attackers who have access to the same network as the client or server to interrupt, end, or steal a session in progress.
segment.target: Session hijacking uses tools that allow attackers who have access to the same network as the client or server to interrupt, end, or steal a session in progress.

segment.source: Attackers can potentially intercept and modify unsigned Server Message Block (SMB) packets and then modify the traffic and forward it so that the server might perform objectionable actions.
segment.target: Attackers can potentially intercept and modify unsigned Server Message Block (SMB) packets and then modify the traffic and forward it so that the server might perform objectionable actions.

segment.source: Alternatively, the attacker could pose as the server or client device after legitimate authentication and gain unauthorized access to data.
segment.target: Alternatively, the attacker could pose as the server or client device after legitimate authentication and gain unauthorized access to data.

segment.source: SMB is the resource-sharing protocol that is supported by many Windows operating systems.
segment.target: SMB is the resource-sharing protocol that is supported by many Windows operating systems.

segment.source: It is the basis of NetBIOS and many other protocols.
segment.target: It is the basis of NetBIOS and many other protocols.

segment.source: SMB signatures authenticate users and the servers that host the data.
segment.target: SMB signatures authenticate users and the servers that host the data.

segment.source: If either side fails the authentication process, data transmission does not take place.
segment.target: If either side fails the authentication process, data transmission does not take place.

segment.source: Countermeasure
segment.target: Countermeasure

segment.source: Configure the settings as follows:
segment.target: Configure the settings as follows:

segment.source: Disable Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (always).
segment.target: Disable Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (always).

segment.source: Disable Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (always).
segment.target: Disable Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (always).

segment.source: Enable Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (if server agrees).
segment.target: Enable Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (if server agrees).

segment.source: Enable Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (if client agrees).
segment.target: Enable Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (if client agrees).

segment.source: In highly secure environments we recommend that you configure all of these settings to Enabled.
segment.target: In highly secure environments we recommend that you configure all of these settings to Enabled.

segment.source: However, that configuration may cause slower performance on client devices and prevent communications with earlier SMB applications and operating systems.
segment.target: However, that configuration may cause slower performance on client devices and prevent communications with earlier SMB applications and operating systems.

segment.source: Note: An alternative countermeasure that could protect all network traffic is to implement digital signatures with IPsec.
segment.target: Note: An alternative countermeasure that could protect all network traffic is to implement digital signatures with IPsec.

segment.source: There are hardware-based accelerators for IPsec encryption and signing that could be used to minimize the performance impact on the servers' CPUs.
segment.target: There are hardware-based accelerators for IPsec encryption and signing that could be used to minimize the performance impact on the servers' CPUs.

segment.source: No such accelerators are available for SMB signing.
segment.target: No such accelerators are available for SMB signing.

segment.source: Potential impact
segment.target: Potential impact

segment.source: Implementations of the SMB file and print-sharing protocol support mutual authentication.
segment.target: Implementations of the SMB file and print-sharing protocol support mutual authentication.

segment.source: This prevents session hijacking attacks and supports message authentication to prevent man-in-the-middle attacks.
segment.target: This prevents session hijacking attacks and supports message authentication to prevent man-in-the-middle attacks.

segment.source: SMB signing provides this authentication by placing a digital signature into each SMB, which is then verified by the client and the server.
segment.target: SMB signing provides this authentication by placing a digital signature into each SMB, which is then verified by the client and the server.

segment.source: Implementation of SMB signing may negatively affect performance because each packet must be signed and verified.
segment.target: Implementation of SMB signing may negatively affect performance because each packet must be signed and verified.

segment.source: If these settings are enabled on a server that is performing multiple roles, such as a small business server that is serving as a domain controller, file server, print server, and application server, performance may be substantially slowed.
segment.target: If these settings are enabled on a server that is performing multiple roles, such as a small business server that is serving as a domain controller, file server, print server, and application server, performance may be substantially slowed.

segment.source: Additionally, if you configure devices to ignore all unsigned SMB communications, older applications and operating systems cannot connect.
segment.target: Additionally, if you configure devices to ignore all unsigned SMB communications, older applications and operating systems cannot connect.

segment.source: However, if you completely disable all SMB signing, devices are vulnerable to session-hijacking attacks.
segment.target: However, if you completely disable all SMB signing, devices are vulnerable to session-hijacking attacks.
